Name: A Blooming Day with SPARK! Exploring the Language of Flowers
Post Body:
On July 12th, the residents of The Gardens at Columbine had a truly special day filled with creativity and connection as we explored the Language of Flowers in partnership with the SPARK! Program. Together with our friends from SPARK!, our Memory Care residents engaged in a fun and meaningful activity, creating beautiful floral arrangements and sharing joyful moments. üå∏

The SPARK! Program: Creating Meaningful Connections

SPARK! is a unique creative engagement program designed specifically for individuals in the early to mid-stages of memory loss and their care partners. The program offers interactive experiences that encourage creativity, stimulate conversations, and foster community connections. Through art-making, music, storytelling, and more, SPARK! creates moments of joy and shared expression. The program is free for families to attend and led by specially trained facilitators, ensuring a supportive and welcoming environment for all participants.

On this day, our activity centered around the Language of Flowers‚Äîa tradition where different flowers symbolize specific emotions and messages. Residents explored the meanings behind various blooms and arranged their own floral creations, expressing themselves through the beauty of nature. The activity sparked conversations, memories, and laughter as residents and care partners connected through the process of creating something beautiful together.

Creativity, Connection, and Fun

Working with the SPARK! Program allowed our residents to dive into a new creative outlet while enjoying the comfort of familiar faces and a supportive environment. Whether it was selecting flowers with special meanings or sharing stories about favorite blooms from their past, the residents had a wonderful time engaging in this sensory-rich activity. The floral arrangements not only added color to our community but also represented the shared moments and connections made during the day.

Looking Forward to More SPARK! Moments

We are so grateful to the SPARK! Program for bringing this enriching experience to The Gardens at Columbine. It‚Äôs programs like these that bring out the best in our community, providing opportunities for creativity, engagement, and meaningful connections. We look forward to welcoming SPARK! back for more activities that help our residents live in the moment and spark joy with one another.

Stay tuned to the Gardens at Columbine activity calendar for more updates on our upcoming SPARK! programs and other exciting community activities.

‚Äç
Post Summary: On July 12th, Gardens at Columbine Memory Care residents partnered with the SPARK! Program for a creative day of flower arranging, fostering connection and joy.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: A Creative Summer Day at Summer Craft Fair
Post Body:
On July 13th, the Gardens at Columbine was filled with creativity, fun, and community spirit as we hosted our annual Summer Craft Fair! The event brought together residents, families, and friends for a day of crafting, shopping, and supporting a great cause. üé®

Crafting for a Cause

Our residents showcased their incredible talents by presenting a wide variety of handmade crafts‚Äîfrom jewelry and home d√©cor to one-of-a-kind art pieces. Visitors had the chance to shop for unique items, with all proceeds from the door prize tickets supporting the Walk to End Alzheimer‚Äôs. Door prize tickets were available for just $1 for 1 ticket or $5 for 6 tickets, allowing everyone the opportunity to win exciting prizes while contributing to an important cause. üíú

Bringing the Community Together

The Summer Craft Fair wasn‚Äôt just about shopping‚Äîit was about fostering connections and bringing people together. The atmosphere was lively, with music, laughter, and the joy of seeing our residents proudly display their creative works. Families, friends, and community members joined in the fun, making it a day to remember for everyone involved.

Supporting Alzheimer‚Äôs Awareness

We are proud to announce that all proceeds from the craft fair will go directly to support the upcoming Walk to End Alzheimer‚Äôs. This event is very close to our hearts, and we‚Äôre grateful to everyone who participated and contributed to raising funds and awareness for such a meaningful cause.

Looking Forward to Next Year

Our Summer Craft Fair was a fantastic success, and we can‚Äôt wait to do it again next year! A heartfelt thank you to all of our residents, staff, and visitors for making this day so special. Your generosity and creativity continue to inspire us.

Stay tuned for more community activities at The Gardens at Columbine as we look forward to another season filled with connection and fun.

‚Äç
Post Summary: Gardens at Columbine‚Äôs Summer Craft Fair brought the community together for a day of crafts and shopping, with all proceeds going to support the Walk to End Alzheimer‚Äôs.

Name: A Day of Adventure at Bear Creek Lake Park
Post Body:
July 10th was a day to remember for the residents of Gardens on Columbine as we ventured out to Bear Creek Lake Park for a fun-filled outdoor adventure! üåû The day brought a perfect mix of sun, clouds, and blue skies, making it the ideal setting for exploring nature and enjoying the beauty of the park. But the real highlight of the day? Horses! üêé

Riding into Fun with Bear Creek Stables

One of the most exciting parts of our outing was the time we spent at Bear Creek Stables, where residents had the chance to get up close with the beautiful horses.

Bear Creek Stables is a family-friendly facility open to anyone looking for a fun experience with horses. They offer much more than just trail rides, too! With summer horse day camps for kids, riding lessons, and pony parties, there's something for everyone at the stables. And for those looking to plan something extra special, Bear Creek Ranch offers year-round special events, including private hay or wagon rides and even carriage rides.

A Day Full of Variety

Our day at Bear Creek Lake Park wasn‚Äôt just about the horses. We enjoyed walks along the park‚Äôs scenic trails, taking in the beautiful blend of nature under changing skies. From bright sunshine to fluffy clouds, the weather kept things interesting, and the peaceful setting of the park made for a wonderful backdrop for our day out.

Looking Ahead to More Adventures

Whether it‚Äôs spending time with animals or simply soaking in the beauty of nature, outings like this remind us of the joys of living life to the fullest. We can‚Äôt wait for our next adventure and want to thank all of the residents and staff who made this trip such a success!

Keep an eye on the Gardens on Columbine event calendar for more exciting outings and community activities.

‚Äç
Post Summary: Gardens on Columbine residents enjoyed a day of sunshine, horses, and fun at Bear Creek Lake Park! Discover how we made the most of the day at the stables.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: A Day of Beauty and Fun at the Denver Botanic Gardens
Post Body:
On June 19th, the residents of Gardens on Columbine enjoyed a truly special outing to the Denver Botanic Gardens! üå∏ Surrounded by the stunning beauty of nature, our community explored lush landscapes, vibrant flowers, and peaceful walking paths. It was a perfect day to embrace the great outdoors, and our residents reveled in the fresh air and the colorful sights all around.

Nature‚Äôs Beauty in Full Bloom

The Denver Botanic Gardens offered a breathtaking array of plants and flowers in full bloom. From exotic orchids to towering trees, there was something captivating at every turn. Our residents wandered through the gardens, admiring the carefully curated landscapes and learning about the fascinating plant species that thrive in Colorado‚Äôs unique climate. The Rose Garden, in particular, was a favorite stop, with its beautiful blooms and fragrant air.

Looking Forward to More Outdoor Adventures

Our trip to the Denver Botanic Gardens was a refreshing and enriching experience for everyone involved. We‚Äôre grateful for the opportunity to enjoy these moments together and can‚Äôt wait for our next adventure. Thank you to all who participated and helped make this outing such a success!

Name: A Day Under the Sea: Gardens at Columbine Visits the Downtown Aquarium
Post Body:
Our spirited residents at Gardens at Columbine recently enjoyed an enchanting outing to the Downtown Aquarium in Denver, a place where marine magic comes to life. This extraordinary destination captivates with more than a million gallons of water-filled wonders and educational exhibits.

Exploring the Depths

One of the day‚Äôs highlights was the mesmerizing underwater tunnel. As we walked beneath the glass, surrounded by the tranquil dance of fish above, the world seemed to slow down, wrapping us in a vivid seascape. The tunnel provided an almost 360-degree view of swaying sea life, from darting fish to slow-moving sharks, offering us a rare perspective of the aquatic world.

Delightful Discoveries

Not to be missed were the charming seahorses, twirling delicately around their underwater plant homes. Watching these graceful creatures was a soothing experience, reminding us of nature‚Äôs delicate balance and beauty.

Interactive Fun

The interactive Stingray Reef was a hit, allowing residents to touch and feed the friendly stingrays. The educational and tactile interaction brought joy and laughter, enriching our understanding of these fascinating animals.

A Day to Remember

Our trip to the Downtown Aquarium was not just an outing but a journey into an underwater kingdom that left us with beautiful memories and stories to share back at Gardens at Columbine. Please check out our activities page for more of our upcoming day trips and excursions!

‚Äç
Post Summary: Residents of Gardens at Columbine enjoyed a memorable outing to Denver‚Äôs Downtown Aquarium, where they delved into the fascinating world of marine life. The day was filled with interactive exhibits offering both education and delight in a serene underwater setting.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: A Day with Abraham Lincoln
Post Body:
History came alive this week as we had the distinct pleasure of hosting John Voehl, a renowned Abraham Lincoln presenter from the Association of Lincoln Presenters. His visit provided a unique opportunity for our residents to step back in time and experience an inspiring slice of American history.

Bringing History to Life

John Voehl, a retired aerospace business professional turned historian and actor, has spent over two decades portraying Abraham Lincoln, giving more than 1,300 presentations across 45 states. His commitment to historical accuracy and engaging storytelling captivated everyone as he shared insights into Lincoln‚Äôs life and legacy.

With over 50 different portrayals in his repertoire, John‚Äôs visit was not just an educational experience; it was as if Lincoln himself had walked through our doors. His presentations are more than just speeches; they are vibrant, interactive sessions that invite the audience to experience the trials and triumphs of one of America‚Äôs most revered figures.

An Inspirational Encounter

During his visit, John discussed several pivotal moments of Lincoln's presidency with an emphasis on the values of honesty, perseverance, and compassion. Residents were particularly moved by his recitation of the Gettysburg Address, which he delivered with profound respect and authenticity. It was a poignant reminder of the enduring power of words and the responsibilities we share as stewards of history.

Reflecting on Our Heritage

The event also allowed our community to reflect on their personal histories and the moments that have shaped our nation. Discussions and questions flowed, creating a lively atmosphere that resonated with the spirit of learning and curiosity.

Gratitude and Looking Forward

We are incredibly grateful to John Voehl for sharing his time and talents with us. His visit was not only educational but also a reminder of the power of history to inspire and educate. It was a memorable day for everyone at Gardens at Columbine, and we look forward to more enriching experiences like this one.

Join us on our blog and social media platforms to stay updated on upcoming events and stories from our vibrant community at the Gardens at Columbine.

‚Äç
Post Summary: Join us at Gardens at Columbine as we relive history with John Voehl, a distinguished Abraham Lincoln presenter. Discover how his visit inspired and educated our residents, bringing the past alive with stories of honesty, perseverance, and compassion.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: A Hauntingly Fun Week
Post Body:
Hello, it's Christa here, your Life Enrichment Director at Gardens at Columbine!

We've just wrapped up another fantastic week here, culminating in our own fabulous costume party! You wouldn't believe the level of creativity on display ‚Äì we had witches, superheroes, and even a few mythical creatures making their rounds in the common areas.

This was such a wonderful opportunity for everyone to express themselves, to laugh and have a good time together. I'm a firm believer that it‚Äôs never too late to channel your inner child and enjoy these moments of fun and whimsy, and seeing our residents getting in on the Halloween spirit was a joy to witness.

As for the weekend, well, we've got plans that'll make even the grumpiest goblin smile. A word to the wise - if you hear knocks on your doors this Sunday, October 31st, be ready with your candy bowls. We're hosting trick-or-treating right here in our assisted living area! It‚Äôs an event that brings everyone together and makes Halloween truly special.

I hope everyone has a spooktacular Halloween weekend! And remember, the real magic lies in the smiles we share, the laughter that echoes through our halls, and the precious moments we create together. So here's to a weekend filled with more of that magic.

Stay safe, enjoy the treats, and keep the fun alive!

Until next time,Christa

Post Summary: Step into a world of playful spooks and sweet treats as we recap our Halloween costume party and upcoming trick-or-treating event at Gardens at Columbine!

Name: A Scenic Escape: Gardens at Columbine‚Äôs Trip to Lookout Mountain
Post Body:
This February, residents of Gardens at Columbine took a memorable journey to one of Golden, Colorado's most cherished natural landmarks‚ÄîLookout Mountain. As we ascended above the city, anticipation grew, promising a day filled with stunning views and historical discoveries.

Ascent to Beauty

Our drive up to Lookout Mountain was as enchanting as the destination itself. Winding roads framed by rugged landscapes led us to the summit, over 7,300 feet above sea level. Known as Golden‚Äôs tallest peak, Lookout Mountain offered us a panoramic spectacle of the Rocky Mountains and sweeping views stretching all the way to Denver.

Echoes of the Past

Upon reaching the top, we were not only greeted by breathtaking vistas but also by a rich tapestry of history. Lookout Mountain has served as a vital lookout point since the days of the Ute Indian Tribe, its formidable height providing a strategic view over the surrounding terrain. This mountain has witnessed the evolution of Golden, playing an integral role in its recreation, transportation, and more.

A Moment to Remember

Spending the day atop Lookout Mountain, our group felt a deeper connection to the natural world and to each other. The expansive views acted as a reminder of the vast beauty that lies just beyond our everyday scenery and of the adventures that await when we explore together.

This trip was more than just a visit to a scenic point; it was a shared experience that enriched our spirits and deepened our appreciation for Colorado's historical and natural heritage.

Join Us on Our Next Adventure

Stay tuned to our blog for more stories and upcoming excursions from Gardens at Columbine using our Activities Calendar. Whether it's exploring the natural beauty of Colorado or enjoying in-house activities, there's always something exciting happening here!

‚Äç
Post Summary: Join Gardens at Columbine residents on a breathtaking journey to Lookout Mountain, Golden, CO‚Äôs tallest peak. Read about our adventure filled with historic insights and stunning Rocky Mountain vistas. Experience the beauty and camaraderie of our community outings.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: Balancing Act: Our Interactive Session with Swedish Medical Center
Post Body:
Hi everyone,

Christa here, your Life Enrichment Director at Gardens at Columbine, bringing you some important insights from our recent session on a critical, yet often overlooked aspect of our lives as we age ‚Äì balance safety.

As we age, maintaining balance can sometimes become more challenging. In fact, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) reports that each year, more than one in four older adults aged 65 and older will fall, making it the leading cause of injury and hospitalization in this age group. This only underscores how important it is for us to understand and prioritize balance safety.

With this in mind, we were privileged to host a team of experts from the esteemed Swedish Medical Center. They provided an enlightening session, offering insights into the science behind balance and the reasons it can waver as we age. We learned that maintaining our balance isn't a simple process. Instead, it involves our visual, auditory, and skeletal systems all working in concert to keep us steady and upright.

But this was more than just a lecture. Our friends from the Swedish Medical Center engaged us with practical exercises, demonstrating tips to enhance our balance and safety. From easy routines that we can incorporate into our daily lives to instructions on the correct posture and safe ways to stand from a seated position, the session was packed with useful, actionable information.

We didn't just sit and listen ‚Äì we got up and got involved. Everyone had the chance to participate in exercises and demonstrations. This interactive approach made the information more relatable, helping us to understand and apply the techniques more effectively.

I can't thank the Swedish Medical Center team enough for their insightful session. Their commitment to our residents' health and safety is commendable. Now, our residents are equipped with essential knowledge to help them maintain their balance, navigate their surroundings more confidently, and live their lives more independently.

Here's to continued learning and growth, and to staying upright, steady, and confident!

Until next time,

Christa

‚Äç
Post Summary: Experience the highlights of our interactive balance safety session with Swedish Medical Center, a step towards safer and more confident living for our residents.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: Bringing Nature Indoors with Our New Eldergrow Garden at Gardens on Columbine
Post Body:
Hello to our Gardens on Columbine family and friends,

We're incredibly excited to share some uplifting news with all of you. We've recently set up an Eldergrow Garden right here in our community! For those who are not familiar, Eldergrow offers more than a simple gardening experience; it's a therapeutic horticulture program that adds a whole new layer to our caregiving approach.

Not Just Plants, But People Too

What makes our Eldergrow Garden special isn't just the array of colorful flowers and aromatic herbs. It's the inclusive experience it provides for all our residents, irrespective of their care needs. Led by trained Eldergrow Educators, our bi-monthly classes are accessible and tailored for both our memory and assisted living residents.

Safety and Sustainability

We're proud that our Eldergrow Garden is not only beautiful but also environmentally responsible and safe. From its organic, pesticide-free soil to its non-toxic plants, we've made sure that our indoor garden is as resident-friendly as possible. Plus, it's mobile, allowing us to bring the joy of gardening to various spaces within our community.

More Than a Gardening Club

Yes, we do have lovely plants, but our Eldergrow Garden is about so much more:

  • Social Opportunities: The garden has become a hub of interaction, allowing residents to engage with each other in a meaningful way.
  • Educational Programs: From history to science and culinary arts, we've broadened the scope of learning for our residents.
  • Cultural Enrichment: The garden is a gateway to the world, offering our residents the chance to explore various cultures through themed gardening activities.

Accessible All Year Round

Our indoor Eldergrow Garden ensures that residents can enjoy the benefits of connecting with nature throughout the year, overcoming the limitations posed by weather or mobility challenges.

Join Us in Our Garden Journey

We wholeheartedly invite all residents and their families to participate in this exciting new endeavor. Come, be a part of our gardening family. You don‚Äôt have to be an expert in gardening; you just need to bring your enthusiasm.

We look forward to sharing this enriching experience with all of you.

Best regards,
Peter

‚Äç
Post Summary: Discover the therapeutic and community-building power of our new Eldergrow Garden at Gardens at Columbine.
Author: helen-rossi

Name: Christmas Tree Decorating Magic
Post Body:

Name: Crafting for a Cause: Gardens at Columbine‚Äôs Fundraiser for the Walk to End Alzheimer‚Äôs
Post Body:
At Gardens at Columbine, we believe that community is at the heart of everything we do‚Äîand that includes supporting families affected by Alzheimer‚Äôs.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre proud to host our annual Craft Fair Fundraiser on Friday, July 19th from 10 AM to 3 PM, as part of our summer-long initiative to raise funds for the Alzheimer‚Äôs Association Walk to End Alzheimer‚Äôs¬Æ.

This event is more than a fundraiser‚Äîit‚Äôs a celebration of compassion, creativity, and connection. Visitors will enjoy a vibrant showcase of handmade crafts from local vendors, participate in exciting door prize giveaways, and connect with a community united by purpose.

We are proud members of The Forget Me Knot Family, a passionate team spanning all four Stage Management communities: Gardens at Columbine, Gardens on Quail, Golden Pond, and Stonebridge. In 2024, we came together to raise an inspiring $23,500, placing second in the Denver Walk.

This year, we‚Äôre aiming higher with a $30,000 goal‚Äîand we need your help.

Whether you walk with us, donate, become a vendor, or simply stop by to shop and show your support, you are making a difference. Together, we walk hand-in-hand with the families we serve, offering care and hope every step of the way.

üì¨ Interested in becoming a vendor? Contact Holly Eames at heames@goldenpond.com.

Let‚Äôs make this summer one of community, creativity, and cause. üíú

Name: Crafting for a Cause: The Summer Craft Fair at Gardens at Columbine
Post Body:

Creativity Meets Charity

The craft fair was a fabulous showcase of talent, featuring everything from handmade jewelry to home decor. The event served not only as a platform for these artisans but also as a community fundraiser. All proceeds collected during the event are going to support our own "Gardens Forget-Me-Nots" in the upcoming Walk to End Alzheimer's.

Warm regards,
Christa

Name: Easter Traditions Come Alive at Gardens at Columbine
Post Body:
Spring has sprung at Gardens at Columbine, and what better way to celebrate than with our annual Easter egg dyeing event? This past Wednesday, residents came together for a fun-filled afternoon of laughter, creativity, and storytelling.

A Palette of Possibilities

With an array of dyes, crayons, and stickers at their disposal, everyone got to work, turning plain white eggs into a spectrum of colors and patterns. Name: Experience Holiday Magic at Bandimere‚Äôs Christmas in Color
Post Body:
This December, the spirit of the holidays was truly in the air as residents of Gardens at Columbine embarked on a short journey West on C470 to Bandimere Speedway for the annual Christmas in Color light show. This electric Christmas experience offered an unforgettable evening of dazzling lights and holiday cheer.

A Drive-Through Wonderland

As we cozied up in our bus, the magic unfolded along a 1,500-foot route adorned with millions of synchronized lights. The music filled the air, each note perfectly timed to the brilliant flashes of color that illuminated the night sky. Driving through stunning light tunnels, it felt as though we were cruising through a cascade of stars and festive delights.

Celebrating Community and Giving Back

Christmas in Color isn't just a spectacular light show; it's an event with a heart. Each ticket sold contributes to the ‚ÄúCome See the Lights‚Äù initiative, which donates tickets to various organizations, helping brighten the season for many more in our community. Knowing that our visit helped contribute to this cause added an extra layer of warmth to our visit.

A New Tradition

This trip has become a cherished part of our holiday traditions at Gardens at Columbine. The joy of sharing this spectacular light show with friends and neighbors, staying warm and comfortable in our bus while the world outside dazzled with holiday spirit, made for a night to remember.

As we returned home, the glow from the lights was matched only by the smiles on our faces. It was a night that reminded us all of the wonder of the season and the joy of community.

Join Us for More Festive Fun

Keep an eye on our blog for more holiday events and stories from Gardens at Columbine. We‚Äôre always finding new ways to celebrate and enjoy the season together!

‚Äç

‚Äç
Post Summary: Join Gardens at Columbine residents for a festive outing to Bandimere‚Äôs Christmas in Color! Read about our magical night amidst millions of synchronized lights and music that brought holiday cheer and a new tradition to our community.

Name: Framing Nature: Gardens on Columbine‚Äôs Photography Club Takes on Our Garden
Post Body:
What could be more enchanting than capturing the kaleidoscope of fall colors that October brings to our gardens? We're delighted to share that our Photography Club had a memorable outing amidst the vivid hues and soft autumn light that our gardens are currently showcasing.

An Autumnal Symphony üçÅ

October has transformed our gardens into a symphony of reds, yellows, and oranges. Today, these radiant colors became the ultimate backdrop for our photography enthusiasts who wanted to capture the essence of fall.

Focus on Fall üì∑

The participants had their work cut out for them‚Äîcapturing the intricate details of fallen leaves, the rich textures of tree barks, and the enchanting play of light and shadow that only autumn can bring.

Community and Creativity üé®

The changing seasons remind us of the beauty of transformation and the Photography Club is no different. Whether you're an expert photographer or a beginner, the club offers a supportive space to explore new techniques and share perspectives.

A Snapshot of Time üì∏

After their creative expedition, the group gathered to review their shots, sharing tips and discussing their favorite autumnal elements.

Join the Next Seasonal Adventure üçÇ

If the idea of capturing the beauty of changing seasons intrigues you, we warmly invite you to join our Photography Club on their next adventure. All skill levels are most welcome!

We can't wait to see how you frame the beauty of our Gardens on Columbine community in your unique way.

Warm regards,
Christa
Post Summary: Join our Photography Club's October outing to experience the Gardens on Columbine in a whole new hue.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: From Seeds to Salad: The Garden Club‚Äôs Tomato Planting Adventure
Post Body:
Hello, Garden enthusiasts!

Christa here, your Life Enrichment Director at Gardens at Columbine, bringing you a delightful update from our Gardening Club. Today was no ordinary day ‚Äì our Memory Care Unit's residents embraced their inner gardeners and embarked on a wonderfully green adventure, planting none other than the culinary staple, the ever-versatile, tomatoes!

Planting a seed may seem like a simple act, but it's incredibly meaningful. It's a promise of life, of growth, and of the delicious fruit that's to come. Our residents delved into this task with enthusiasm and anticipation, their faces lit up with joy and pride as they planted their tomato seeds in our garden.

Our garden club event wasn't just about getting our hands dirty, though. This was a chance to stimulate our senses and evoke fond memories. The fresh, earthy scent of the soil, the vibrant green of the tomato seedlings, and the promise of biting into a fresh, juicy tomato in the near future... all these experiences have the power to unlock beautiful memories and feelings.

While our residents took turns carefully placing each seed into the soil, we spoke about the life cycle of a tomato plant, its needs, and the rewarding process of tending a garden. Through these discussions, we not only shared knowledge but also encouraged our residents to engage, interact, and connect with each other, nurturing our community spirit.

Moreover, this activity was a chance to enjoy the outdoors and bask in the therapeutic effects of nature. We spent a glorious day under the beautiful Colorado sky in our inner courtyard with the sun softly shining down on us.

Looking ahead, we'll be patiently tending to our tomato plants, waiting for the day when we can harvest the fruits of our labor and perhaps use them in a meal right here at Gardens at Columbine. We also plan on coordinating with some of the local Littleton Garden Clubs for some more hands on demonstrations. These include Littleton Garden Gang, City run garden plots, Littleton Pea Patch, and the Hudson Gardens.

We can't wait to share with you the progress of our tomato garden ‚Äì watch this space!

Until next time, keep growing, keep flourishing!

Christa

‚Äç
Post Summary: Discover how our Garden Club's hands-on horticulture is sowing seeds of joy and reaping the benefits of therapeutic gardening.
Author: sydney-hertz

Author: helen-rossi

Name: Lions and Tigers and Bears, Oh My! A Roaring Good Time at the Denver Zoo
Post Body:
It was an exciting day for the residents of Gardens on Columbine as we embarked on a wild adventure to the Denver Zoo! ü¶Å The air was filled with excitement as we strolled through the exhibits, taking in the sights and sounds of lions, tigers, bears, and so many other incredible animals. Our residents enjoyed every moment of the day, from seeing the majestic creatures up close to sharing laughter and stories along the way.

Creating New Memories Together

The trip wasn't just about seeing the animals‚Äîit was about connecting with one another. As we explored the zoo, our residents shared memories of past trips and favorite animals, deepening the bonds that make Gardens on Columbine such a vibrant and supportive community. Whether it was reminiscing about childhood visits to the zoo or discovering new favorite animals, this outing brought us all closer together.

Looking Forward to More Adventures

We are so grateful to everyone who made this trip possible and to the residents who brought their excitement and joy to the day. Our visit to the Denver Zoo was a wild success, and we can‚Äôt wait for our next adventure!

Stay tuned to the Gardens on Columbine event calendar for more fun outings and community activities. We‚Äôre always looking for new ways to explore, connect, and make memories together.

‚Äç
Post Summary: Gardens on Columbine residents had a wild time visiting the Denver Zoo! See how we enjoyed a fun-filled day with lions, tigers, bears, and more.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: Memory Care Residents Tee Off
Post Body:
Amidst the warm hues of Colorado's fall and under a bright November sun, the memory care residents enjoyed a delightful day of putt-putt golf in our courtyard. This special event made the most of the season‚Äôs beautiful weather, offering residents an invigorating outdoor experience.

Creating a Colorful Course

With the courtyard awash in autumn sunshine and surrounded by the vibrant colors of fall, our team set up a charming mini-golf course. Residents, each with a putter in hand, navigated the course with enthusiasm and a touch of competitive spirit. The game sparked laughter and friendly banter, fostering a light-hearted atmosphere that was infectious. As balls rolled into holes, the air was filled with cheers and encouragement from peers and staff alike.

Enhancing Well-being with Every Swing

The benefits of the day were manifold. Physically, the gentle activity helped residents with their hand-eye coordination and mobility. Mentally, figuring out the best angles for their shots kept their minds active. Socially, the event was a great way for residents to interact, enhancing feelings of belonging and joy.

More Good Times Ahead

Due to the success of this event, we are excited to plan more outdoor activities that take advantage of Colorado's wonderful weather and our beautiful outdoor spaces. At Gardens at Columbine, every season is an opportunity to engage, enjoy, and celebrate life.

‚Äç
Post Summary: Autumn Putt-Putt: A Sunny Fall Day of Mini Golf for Memory Care Residents
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: Mission to the Moon: Gardens at Columbine's Trip to the Apollo Exhibit
Post Body:
Hello to our wonderful community! This is Christa, your Life Enrichment Director from Gardens at Columbine.

Did you know that in 1969, a trembling seat and a countdown was all it took to launch us into a new era? The world held its breath as U.S. Commander Neil Armstrong embarked on Apollo 11, the mission to land the first man on the moon. I bet many of you remember that historic moment as vividly as yesterday.

Well, recently, our residents and I had the chance to relive this extraordinary period of history. We took a trip to the Denver Museum of Nature & Science, where we journeyed through time to witness the U.S.'s audacious foray into space.

The Museum‚Äôs travelling exhibition, ‚ÄúApollo: When We Went to the Moon,‚Äù beautifully encapsulates the thrilling space race that led up to that epochal moon landing. With over 100 artifacts from the U.S. Space and Rocket Center‚Äôs archives on display, it was as if we'd stepped into the control room ourselves.

What truly made this experience special was the multi-sensory aspect of the exhibition. Our residents got to leave their footprints on a virtual moon surface and even climb aboard a model of a lunar rover. Imagine the excitement of rolling across the moon's terrain!

This wasn‚Äôt just a trip to a museum, but a journey back to a time when we dared to do the impossible and succeeded. A time that many of our residents recall with pride and nostalgia. The memories, the emotions, and the sense of achievement were all palpable, and made our trip a truly enriching experience.

We're so grateful for these opportunities to explore and learn together. The world may have been to the moon, but here at Gardens at Columbine, our adventures are far from over. Stay tuned for our next outing, and until then, keep reaching for the stars!

Christa

‚Äç
Post Summary: Experience our out-of-this-world adventure at the Apollo exhibit, where we relived the excitement of mankind's first steps on the moon.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: Paws, Music, and Movement: A Dancing Day with Mile High Musical Tails
Post Body:
Hello, Friends of Gardens at Columbine,

Christa here, your Life Enrichment Director, back with another exciting update! Today was an absolute blast as we hosted the delightful team from Mile High Musical Tails. If you're unfamiliar, this is a club dedicated to fostering closer bonds between people and their dogs through a fun and unique activity ‚Äì canine freestyle dancing.

We were honored to have the presence of the club's founder and president, Sue Cianfarani, a former social worker turned passionate dog trainer. Sue discovered dog dancing back in 1999 and has since dedicated her life to this wonderful activity, establishing Mile High Musical Tails in 2002. Her team started with just five dog owners but has grown exponentially, dancing their way into the hearts of many.

Our residents, staff, and visitors had the pleasure of witnessing the beautiful synergy between the dancing dogs and their owners. It was not just entertaining but also incredibly heartwarming to see the deep bond and communication between them as they moved gracefully to the music. The dogs were not just following commands, but genuinely enjoying the rhythm, music, and companionship. It was, without a doubt, an eye-opening demonstration of the wonderful relationship one can have with their furry friends.

In addition to the amazing performances, Sue and her team took the time to share their journey and the benefits of canine freestyle dancing. The most notable takeaway was how this activity promotes responsible pet ownership and establishes a profound connection between dogs and their owners (we are apet friendly facility so if you or your loved one are nervous about leaving a best friend behind you can bring them with you at this facility). It goes to show how communication with our pets can go beyond the traditional bounds and turn into something extraordinarily beautiful.

I can safely say that our day with Mile High Musical Tails left us all with smiles on our faces and a newfound appreciation for the relationship we can cultivate with our pets. It was a day filled with joy, music, wagging tails, and of course, some impressive dance moves!

For those who couldn't join us today, I encourage you to check out Mile High Musical Tails' website and learn more about this wonderful club. And who knows? Maybe we will have them back for an encore performance!

Until next time, keep dancing, keep loving, and keep cherishing those special bonds.

Christa

‚Äç
Post Summary: Experience the fun and joy our residents shared with Mile High Musical Tails, an innovative club that intertwines the love of dogs and dance.
Author: sydney-hertz

Name: Unleashing Creativity: Pour Paint Class at Gardens at Columbine
Post Body:
Hello there, Christa here again! We recently hosted a truly spectacular Pour Paint Class that I‚Äôm thrilled to share with you all.

An Afternoon of Artistic Exploration

Our residents, staff, and even some of our neighbors gathered for an afternoon that combined art, friendship, and a splash of color‚Äîliterally! Guided by a local artist, attendees discovered the mesmerizing technique of pour painting.

More Than Just Art

Art has the power to bring people together, and this event did just that. It was more than just swirling colors onto canvas; it was an enriching experience that allowed us to connect, unwind, and discover hidden talents among us.

Therapeutic Moments

Art has well-known therapeutic benefits, offering not only a creative outlet but also an opportunity for relaxation and mental well-being. This class was a mini-retreat from our busy lives, an oasis of calm in the midst of our usual routines.

Closing Notes

Thank you to everyone who joined us for this artistic endeavor! It was a day filled with creativity, connection, and most importantly, community.

Until next time,Christa

‚Äç
Post Summary: Take a look at how an afternoon of pour painting at Gardens at Columbine turned into a therapeutic and community-building experience.
Author: sydney-hertz
